spec.scope: XQuery is a query language for addressing parts of an XML document.

info.p: XQuery is a query language, which is used for requesting collections of XML data, developed by W3C. XQuery is designed for working with XML, but it does not use XML's syntax (although there is an XQueryX version, that makes use of XML's syntax, it is only seldomly used). XQuery is applied versatilely for example for extraction of informations from a XML database, for searching textual documents on the web, for information extraction, etc. Furthermore XQuery allows to modify the data or sort the returned results.
The queries in XQuery are able to read, return, add a sequence of XML fragments or atomic values from input documents.
XQuery relies on other specifications of W3C such as XML 1.1, Namespaces, XPath and XML Schema datatypes.
One of the reasons why XQuery is so widely accepted is that it is supported by all major databases.

info.p: XQuery is a superset of XPath 2.0, which is a superset of XPath 1.0
